<MembersIndexItem

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86-64machotargetobjectfile">X86&#95;64MachoTargetObjectFile</a> - This TLOF implementation is used for Darwin x86-64. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86-64machotargetobjectfile/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86elftargetobjectfile">X86ELFTargetObjectFile</a></>}>
This implementation is used for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> targets that don&#39;t have a further specialization (and as a base class for X86&#95;64, which does). <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86elftargetobjectfile/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86-64elftargetobjectfile">X86_64ELFTargetObjectFile</a></>}>
This implementation is used for X86&#95;64 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> targets, and defers to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86elftargetobjectfile">X86ELFTargetObjectFile</a> for commonalities with 32-bit targets. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86-64elftargetobjectfile/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>
